00017 ivec GreedyMaxMinDesign::subsample(mat X, int n)
00018 {
00019     if (n <= 0)
00020         cerr << "Invalid sample size in GreedyMaxMinDesign::subsample(...)" << endl;
00021     
00022     int imax;
00023     
00024     ivec isample(n);        // Indices of points in sample
00025     ivec iremain;           // Indices of remaining points
00026     vec D;                  // Vector of min distances to sample
00027     
00028     iremain = to_ivec(linspace(0,X.rows()-1,X.rows()));
00029     
00030     // Start with location of maximum Z
00031     max(X.get_col(X.cols()-1), imax);
00032     isample(0) = imax;
00033     iremain.del(imax);
00034 
00035     // Add points having maximum minimum distance to sample
00036     // until subsample size is reached 
00037     for (int i=1; i<n; i++) 
00038     {
00039         vec xnew = X.get_row(isample(i-1));                // Last point added 
00040         vec Dnew = dist(X.get_rows(iremain), xnew);        // Distances to xnew
00041                 
00042         // Update minimum distances to sample
00043         if (D.length() == 0) 
00044             D = Dnew;
00045         else
00046             D = min(D,Dnew);
00047         
00048         // Find point with max min distance
00049         max(D,imax);
00050         
00051         // Add it to sample 
00052         isample(i) = iremain(imax);
00053         
00054         // And delete it from remainder 
00055         iremain.del(imax);
00056         D.del(imax);
00057     }
00058     
00059     return isample;
00060 }
00061 
00065 vec GreedyMaxMinDesign::dist(mat R, vec y)
00066 {
00067     vec distances(R.rows());
00068     
00069     // For each point x in R
00070     for (int i=0; i<R.rows(); i++) {
00071         vec x = R.get_row(i);
00072         distances(i) = weightedSquareNorm(x-y);
00073     }
00074     
00075     return distances;
00076 }
00077 
00083 double GreedyMaxMinDesign::weightedSquareNorm(vec v) 
00084 {
00085    double sqnorm = 0.0;
00086    
00087    for (int i=0; i<v.length()-1; i++) {
00088        sqnorm += pow(v(i),2.0);
00089    }   
00090    sqnorm += zweight*pow(v(v.length()-1),2.0);
00091    
00092    return sqnorm;
00093 }
